result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Mario Samuel Gualtieri was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Probation may be transferred to the State of Virginia.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

miscConds.notes: AODA assesment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

No use or possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of probation.
Not to drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Cash bail applied.  PAID IN FULL.
Cash bail applied to DNA surcharge and Extradition costs.  PAID IN FULL.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with all standard release conditions, commencing FORTHWITH.  
Apply 88 days sentence credit (defendant has 92 days remaining of condition time).

records.addlTxt: Order vacating Bail Forfeiture

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mario Samuel Gualtieri in court with attorney Julia C Westley.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Monica Walrath, Assistant Corporation Counsel on behalf of the County appeared on motion to vacate bail forfeiture. 
Court addressed motion to reinstate forfeited bail.
State does not object to motion.
Ass't Corporation Counsel Walrath objects to defense motion.
Court vacates order to forfeit bail. Court reinstates $14,500.00 and allows $500.00 to be kept and remain forfeited for the County's expenses.
Court proceeds with plea and sentencing hearing. 
Defendant entered a plea of guilty to count 1. Court found defendant guilty.
Count 2 dismissed by operation of law. 

The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

WITHHELD SENTENCE OF:   

 *D/L REVOCATION: 24 months.
*IGNITION INTERLOCK: 24 months.

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS;

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of probation.  
*Do not drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done (no surcharges).


FINE:  $2055.00. Apply cash bail;

DNA SURCHARGE: $268.00. Apply cash bail;

RESTITUTION: $2010.56 IN EXTRADITION COSTS ($1610.56 Florida extradition costs and $400.00 for Illinois extradition costs). Apply cash bail. 

CONDITION TIME:  180 DAYS NON WORKING HOURS w/Standard Release Conditions. 88 DAYS CREDIT GIVEN TO THE CONDITION TIME. Defendant has 92 days remaining of condition time. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

PROBATION MAY BE TRANSFERRED TO THE STATE OF VIRGINA.
